copy: If you would like to see what files have been changed and what has been tracked, you can use the git status command.

content.label: SECTION
content.heading: Pull
copy: If you're working on a project with multiple developers, you may find yourself in a position where a repo, possibly on GitHub, was updated but you don't have the latest changes locally. You need to use Git to pull the latest and most recent changes from the remote branch to your local:
content.label: CODE/MARKUP
SECTION
content.heading: Delete Branch
copy: Once you no-longer require a feature branch within your repository, use the following Git command to delete it. You will also need to possibly delete the branch on your remote repository.
content.label: CODE/MARKUP
code: # Delete branch on your remote repository

copy: Once you have completed your work and are ready to commit your changes, you can use the following commands below.
Before you commit any changes, make sure you are working on the correct branch.
